website_summaries.verdict: A huge fan for large attics with a shutter vent that really moves some air.
pros: Works in a large house with 2,000 to 3,000 square feet of attic space
Pulls in fresh air and exhausts hot air from the attic
A good traditional attic fan to cool the house at night
cons: 30-inch fan works best only if your house is large enough for it

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality & Manufacturer Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The first fan we ordered didn't work at all. The second one worked less than 15 times. While the manufacturer does offer a one year warranty, they do not cover shipping of the defective part which can be considerable depending on the part. I do not recommend this product or the company's customer service. Sorry I ordered from this manufacturer at all.
customer_reviews.author: zach Goins

customer_reviews.title: Test before cutting a hole in your ceiling!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this whole house fan, installed it and the motor caught on fire when turned on....thinking it was a return, and returned for a reason. Now stuck with a huge hole in my ceiling until the new fan arrives. Not happy about this whole purchase. Doesn't deserve one star.
customer_reviews.author: papper

customer_reviews.title: YouTube install or electrician install.
customer_reviews.text: Low setting gives a low rumble, quite enough to sleep through. high setting is a bit louder, too loud to sleep throug unless heavy sleeper. Both settings move lots of air. Tied fan to a smart switch so I don't have to go upstairs. Ducts open and close as described. Duct does not keep heat out from attic. Duct does not open all the way but I believe it's the airflow to the duct. Can be diy via YouTube. Works for inland house where during the summer it reaches 117 but at night drops to 70s. Recommend getting attic fans with thermal switches along with this to keep your house cool.
customer_reviews.author: juan manuel hernandez jr

customer_reviews.title: Cools my house OR my garage.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this fan in the ceiling of my finished attached garage. My garage doors face West, so late in the day the sun gets the doors really hot, which heats up the garage in the summer. I shut the house door, open the garage door and pull the heat out of the garage into the attic and out through the roof vents. When I want fresh air in the house, I open windows and the door between the house & garage, shut garage doors, turn fan on and enjoy the breeze. I really enjoy this fan!
customer_reviews.author: AlinMichigan

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Don't save a dollar and gain a headache, go with quality you can trust. THAT WAS IN THERE DESCRIPTION. Very disappointing. It arrived timely. I recieved two high/low switches instead of a high/low and on/off switch. Also the cover plate came with no screws. I got everything installed. Mind you I'm sort of a Jack all trades, nothing works so far. I'm going to have an electrician come out to check everything and determine if the brand new motor is shot.
customer_reviews.author: JASON

customer_reviews.title: Junk! No Customer Service! No Warrenty!
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Motor lasted only 3 years of lite use. Customer service is non exist! 10 year warranty is not true! I hate false advertisement!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I found this fan a good value. I have installed $1100 fans and found this good quality for the price. Directions were spot on. The only thing I added was a countdown timer and I put closed cell weather striping around the edge of the fan box. The weather Striping reduced vibration and noise for about $5.00. When I first started the fan it had a clunk sound. After a little troubleshooting I found the fan pulley was a little loose a quick tightening with an Allen wrench and all was good. The first time I turned the fan on it dropped the attic tempature 6 degrees in 10 min. I would recommend this fan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cools home, easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Cools home well. I live where there is very low humidity so I don't see/ feel the concerns some state. When the sun sets and it cools, i open our windows and turn this on and cool it down very fast. I'll shut it off after 2-3 hours. I now only use my air conditioner in the afternoon where as before it would run from mid morning to midnight. It is quieter than our old swamp cooler. Only complaint is that it is so strong it'll pop my ears if I don't open enough windows.
customer_reviews.author: The House

customer_reviews.title: Fan works great, cover keeps cracking
customer_reviews.text: The attic fan is perfect for our house. We have a 2600 square ft 2 story home and it circulates air through the entire house. The downside is the cover began cracking less than a month after we got it. We've tried contacting customer support and never received a response...
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Several issues.
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived damaged. Box seemed fine, but once I removed the fan, I noticed it would not spin freely, and the mounting bracket was bent. (See photos) After some serious reforming of the bracket, I got it to operate correctly. The measurements for mounting the fan were terrible, and I had to basically form a custom mount. Also, the size chart I feel was wrong. I purchased the 24" because the description stated this was good for 1800 sq ft. My house is 1775 sq ft, and this fan moves little to no air. I would purchase the next size up if I could do it over, but I'm not about to remove this fan and send back.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Used our fan 5-6 times before it  stopped working. Money down the drain
customer_reviews.text: Used this product 5-6 before it went out. Had Horrible luck with this product very very frustrating !!! I bought back in May, had it installed and we used it maybe 5-6 times at night to cool down the house. The last time We ran it for a hr prior to going to bed, the next evening I went to turn the fan on and it wouldn’t turn on. It has power to the fan so I’m guessing the motor is toast. Don’t waste ur money. Money down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great fan for a 1,600 sqft house
customer_reviews.text: Only had one minor issue with the fan motor. The set screw on the motor-shaft had loosened slightly causing the belt to slip. Once the set screw was tightened up we have had no issues with the fan. The fan works fantastic in our 1,600 sq-ft house. The install instructions were pretty detailed and it only took a few hours. Really the hardest part was the house wiring and that was only because the previous owner had done some goofy things to the circuit i hooked it into.
customer_reviews.author: Tweakes182

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and works well
customer_reviews.text: fan is nice and quiet, but I was replacing a unit I bought from Home Depot years ago...the blade design does not move as much air as the other did, but it is quieter. Also, my old louvers had a different dimension, so I would have had to cut the opening in the ceiling out larger, but instead I was able to buy a replacement louver from HD the same size as the original. If you are doing a new installation, this is a really good and quiet unit, I just wish it moved as much air as my old unit did, and I think this is due to the fan blade design. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkymike1

customer_reviews.title: Great fan.  Have an extra on/off light switch.  Highly recommend the fan.  Actual fan unit itself is quality and purposeful.
customer_reviews.text: Great fan. Shutter damaged but box OK (leading me to blame quality control, not shipping). Amazon customer service is great at least. The on off switch does suck (as i read in others reviews), had to get a new one as it broke in minutes. Luckily I had extras on hand. The fan itself is excellent, I am uber pleased with it. Not too loud. Makes an amazing difference. Highly recommend! Shutter function is great, but I do wish for some foam padding on backing. I plan to need to install a heavy duty cover in place of or over shutter for winter season.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Pace

customer_reviews.title: Great fan.  Have an extra on/off light switch.  Highly recommend the fan.  Actual fan unit itself is quality and purposeful.
customer_reviews.text: Great fan. Shutter damaged but box OK (leading me to blame quality control, not shipping). Amazon customer service is great at least. The on off switch does suck (as i read in others reviews), had to get a new one as it broke in minutes. Luckily I had extras on hand. The fan itself is excellent, I am uber pleased with it. Not too loud. Makes an amazing difference. Highly recommend! Shutter function is great, but I do wish for some foam padding on backing. I plan to need to install a heavy duty cover in place of or over shutter for winter season.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Pace

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this fan! Don't hesitate...
customer_reviews.text: We have a 2 story partially bermed house about 2200 square feet and this fan is fantastic for us! On low, it does the job. The switches are pretty cheesy, but they work for now. It was a little twitchy installing it due to our roof joists, but it worked out well and we're really happy with it's performance so far. It is NOT overly noisy although when you are close to the fan, it does become difficult to have a conversation. If you're in the market for whole house fan, don't hesitate on this!
customer_reviews.author: David Hannes

customer_reviews.title: No install instructions for truss roof
customer_reviews.text: This fan definitely pulls air. The instructions are for a simple joist setup not for a truss style roof. I originally thought about cutting 2 cross beams in the truss and reinforce them using the trusses on either side to make for an easy install but after much research that's not a good idea if you eventually want to sell the house and an inspection is needed. I ended up building a chute made of 2x10 and 2x6 lumber , notching out around truss. The fan sits about 20 inches above vent with close to 36 inches of clearance from fan to roof. All said and done well worth the work.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S

customer_reviews.title: It moves a good amount of air and is quieter than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Received the fan and all parts were included. Nothing was missing or dented. I removed and reinstalled the motor, cut the drywall a little smaller then trimmed to fit the grate. I cut a joist, framed in the box. I put on the flat 2x6s and put window weather stripping foam to the underside of the fan box. Wired up the switches and it kicked on. It moves a good amount of air and is quieter than I expected, maybe due to the foam padding. Only had it on this morning and it was already heating up outside, so we'll see how it works in the evening.
customer_reviews.author: Th3R00ST3R

customer_reviews.title: The installation video on the Amazon site provides some excellent guidance. I did follow the advice from others ...
customer_reviews.text: The fan has operated perfectly for several weeks of very HOT days in the San Francisco area of California. Be certain to RE-tighten all of the nuts and bolts on the support frame; especially for the fan blade attached to the motor shaft. The installation video on the Amazon site provides some excellent guidance. I did follow the advice from others to reduce the pulley size on the motor to reduce the fan speed, which reduces the noise from the fan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not working after less than 3 months of use
customer_reviews.text: We used the many helpful suggestions in the reviews for the installation. While the fan worked, it definitely moved a lot of air through the house and apparently pushed hot air out of the attic. Even using the suggested installation techniques to make the fan less noisy while being operated, it is still very loud--but we got used to it and it wouldn't prevent me from recommending the product. Unfortunately, however, one of the blades sheared off at the attachment point less than three months after it was installed. We will be contacting the manufacturer (Ventamatic) tomorrow to see if they stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: BWM San Diego

customer_reviews.title: could not use
customer_reviews.text: the fan was a piece of junk. the assembly would not allow the fan to spin without hitting the shroud or a piece of the motor. We thought about moving the motor mount around on the frame, but decided that might impact the performance. Put it back in the box and shipped it back. There were so few pieces in the assembly it is amazing they made so many mistakes in construction
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: no mounting hardware
customer_reviews.text: The Cool Attic CX24DDWT Direct Drive 2-Speed Whole House Attic Fan did not include any mounting brackets or screws to secure it to the joists. And the shutter dimensions are smaller than the box that surrounds the fan, so the hole in the ceiling is difficult to frame in so that both are accommodated. It is also noisier than the fan that was replaced.
customer_reviews.author: BackRoads

customer_reviews.title: Makes a big difference!
customer_reviews.text: This fan works great. Took awhile to install, mainly because my attic is a pain in the ass to get in and out of. Works great, you can feel the air moving through the house. Only regret is not doing it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Johnson Jr

customer_reviews.title: Arrived without pulley on motor - customer service number is out of order!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Spent a good part of a day with a perfect install, only to realize there's no pulley on the motor!!!! Amazon recommends contacting mfg and the 800 # doesn't even go through! Sept 10th update - increased to 3 stars from one: Construction seems good and Amazon took care of the issue immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Jhanses

customer_reviews.title: Not as powerful as the fan it replaced
customer_reviews.text: Essentially the high speed and the low speed are about the same. I suppose if people want quiet above all else, that's the compromise. I doubt I would have bought it had I known. However, while it's not the fan I'd have wanted, it probably would be fine for others.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Attic Fan but only lasted two years
customer_reviews.text: Problem is it only lasted two years. I moved back to Laguna Beach one street above where I lived in High School. All medallion homes with no AC. Since Laguna Beach cools off nicely at night, I turn it on to pull in the cool air until I go to bed. In the morning if still cool outside I turn it on again. House stays at about 75 degrees most of the day and then up to 79 late in the day.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Draws Gentle Breeze Through House
customer_reviews.text: I have a one-story, 2000 sf house. This fan draws a gentle breeze from any window in the house when set to "high". Quickly clears a smoky/dusty/humid room. Only thing I don't like is that it is louder than an average conversation on high. BUT...it works so well that I never need to run it more than a 5-10 minutes to changeover the air in the house. Would purchase again. I don't know how easy to install it is, but it needs bracing (2x4s are fine) + its own electrical line (no plug/outlet).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend for saving on the electric bill!
customer_reviews.text: I have been SO thankful for this attic fan! We live in Texas, it gets HOT here! We installed this back in June, was already a little hot then, but have really enjoyed it this fall! Brings in cool air, my son says it is a little loud, but it is right outside his bedroom. Across the house, we don't hear it, has saved us turning the air cooler on many occasions!
customer_reviews.author: AgentAmandaB

customer_reviews.title: Using it as I type this.  Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Did a joist out installation; The house is approx 800 sq feet. We leave it on low mostly, and it's been doing a great job. The price didn't hurt too bad either. NOTE: the shutter did take some minor tweaking to open/close smoothly, but it didn't take a masters in mechanical engineering to figure it out and get it working properly. Overall, I'm very happy with this fan. Made in USA to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt C

customer_reviews.title: This is a great fan, exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fan, exactly what I was looking for...EXCEPT one of the four fan blades is bent incorrectly causing the fan assembly to be out of balance when running. This results in excess vibration and noise. Though now installed, the fan is unusable until the ban blade assembly is replaced. It would be ridiculous to return the entire fan--it's big. If the blade assembly is replaced, I will gladly change my rating.
customer_reviews.author: nels

customer_reviews.title: Easy buy and IS great product
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily and works very well! Happy I bought it. And happy I bought it on Amazon (buying local at same price or for less (even a little more) is far better and exceedingly more satisfying). But at times WE FAIL OURSELVES AND COMMUNITY and duh buy online...shame we harm our own country and COMMUNITY but online can work too.
customer_reviews.author: TexasTiger

customer_reviews.title: Electric motor broke after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Bought ceiling fan two years ago. installation was easy, the unit worked well. two years later motor has a knocking sound and will not spin up the unit to speed. Attempted contacted manufacturer, no response from email and phone does not connect.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Jeffries

customer_reviews.title: Great fan that made house livable again in the summer.
customer_reviews.text: After a year plus of use I will say this is a great fan. After the first couple days you don't even notice the fan noise (which isn't loud in my opinion), but man do you notice the cooling effect. I live in a 100 year old 2500 sq/ft house with no insulation and no central air. It used to be unbearable to be in the house in the summer. Now it's always a nice cool temperature. Granted on +90 Degree days, the house is still hot, but no where close to how it used to be. Highly recommend this fan and highly recommend the direct drive. Easy install also.
customer_reviews.author: Matt W.

customer_reviews.title: This fan kept the house at comfortable temps the rest of the time
customer_reviews.text: Everything just as advertized. A bit of denting on the louvers due to the packaging, but they work okay after straightening. Going on our second season of summer cooling with this fan and it does well in our one story, 2350 sq. ft. house. We live in the Central Valley of CA and only needed to use our air conditioning about 5 or 6 days last summer. This fan kept the house at comfortable temps the rest of the time. We have it on a time which runs it for about 3 hours in the very early morning (3 am to 6 am) to draw in outside air and blow the accumulated hot air out of the attic.
customer_reviews.author: dewey

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Quieter than I expected. Has worked well for the last month. Our old fan was fully variable speed instead of two speed but that hasn't been as much of a problem as I expected. The slow speed is quiet and not annoying. I had to adapt the ceiling hole as the old and new fans had different rectangle dimensions. Very straightforward to install. Had to do some trimming since the old 30 inch fan required a bigger hole.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Miller

customer_reviews.title: Only need AC 5-8 nights a year thanks to this beauty
customer_reviews.text: I installed it in my apartment in LA. It quickly brings in the cool evening air, cooling down the whole 1550 square foot apartment in about 15 minutes. I put it in a hallway away from bedrooms so the noise isn't anything more than noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Bourne

customer_reviews.title: ... had it for 2 days and it is working fine. Be sure to install it as far away ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only had it for 2 days and it is working fine. Be sure to install it as far away as possible from where you normally hang out in the house. It is a little loud. I would also purchase some galvanized 90 deg brackets to install it to the 2 x 6 base. I used (8) 4" long simpson style brackets. Flat black paint works real well to conceal the wood when the vents open.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle V.

customer_reviews.title: Good fan, needs better packing for louvers
customer_reviews.text: Really good fan, does what i want it to, moves lots of air and is fairly quiet. Three stars because the wood sides were split where the motor brackets attach and the louvers arrived scratched. They could have been packed better. The instructions are adequate if you are familiar with electric wiring and working with relocating ceiling joists.
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Moves air well, but hi/low switch broken
customer_reviews.text: I'm hoping seller can help resolve, but the high/low switch often fails to engage the High mode. If i tap switch housing with my fingertip hard, then it will work. I used volt meter and don't get 120VAC at the High terminal when switching unless i tap, so i know it's an internal switch problem and not a faulty wiring job. Everything else about this fan is great though!
customer_reviews.author: J. Haury

customer_reviews.title: This fan is awesome though! I amazing amount of airflow in my ...
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to installing this fan over the weekend. For the most part the kit is complete. I had to buy romex (power wire), A box to install switches in the wall. Silicon to seal up the manifold, 3 2x4s, and 1 1x6 which i ripped into 1x2s to build a base. This fan is awesome though! I amazing amount of airflow in my house 4bd 1600sq ft. This is a must have item in any house my opinion. about 75db on low and about 81db on high, not too loud, certainly welcome the cool house over the noise. It really makes a difference in being able to cool the home.
customer_reviews.author: andy parsons

customer_reviews.title: Good deal and works well
customer_reviews.text: Came defective so half of the flaps would not open all the way. My contractor removed the metal part that was in the way. We do love the function though! They are loud, as to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: So far, not so good, gets worse
customer_reviews.text: broken start capacitor √ Venturi bent so blade hits √ corner of main framework bent and the impact welds in the corners are all popped loose √ metal motor frame itself bent √ afraid to even open louver box √ opened louver box and fears confirmed √ calling Amazon √ This fan is shipped with the motor bolted onto the thin metal frame and the louvers are packed tight against the outside of the box where any bumping will cause bends and kinks. I don't think there is much chance of one of these ever arriving undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: art in p.a.

customer_reviews.title: Moves a lot of air.
customer_reviews.text: Works very (too) well. I'd like to a little different gearing or wiring to make low speed lower. I noticed the ceiling vent leaks cold attic air when off. My previous set of louvers had foam strip along the edges.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Save a lot of electricity
customer_reviews.text: The fan is awesome we are barely using the air conditioning anymore. I watched the 1980s corny install video a few times and it took me a day to install. Hardest part is figuring where to put it in the attic and trying to determine where that is in the ceiling. I recessed the fan higher and the noise level is perfect. I used weatherstripping to limit vibration. I love attic fans. This one is great for out 4000sq ft home.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I like
customer_reviews.text: Fan works great. Just recently installed but seems well built. I compared it to the very old fan that was removed and this one passed the test. We always say, they don’t make ‘me like they used to but, this one was damn close. I didn’t install it but my guy made it look easy. A little loud on high but, I sort of expected that. Anita
customer_reviews.author: Anita M.

customer_reviews.title: Fan arrived Un-damaged and with all parts necessary
customer_reviews.text: Fan arrived today with zero damage and all parts accounted for. I will install it tomorrow and write a follow up review. One thing to note, on this fan, you have to remove the motor and flip it over while installing the fan belt before you install the actual fan into your attic/open space.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Attic Fan
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to install an attic fan myself, very simple and it works great. It is quite and after 1.5 years of use not one problem! It has no problem pulling air into our 2,800 sq/ft house. Be sure that you have/add plenty of attic vents or this high volume fan will build pressure in your attic. I built mine on hinges so in the winter I can lift it up and place insulation above the shutter, took some extra install time but makes getting ready for winter only take a minute or two.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Fun

customer_reviews.title: bathroom
customer_reviews.text: installed this in my bathroom , a bit loud but it gets the job done , in about 0.03 sec it sucks out all the air in my bathroom and no one knows i was even in there , its awesome ! great fart fan!!!
customer_reviews.author: Edward M

customer_reviews.title: Extremely loud and one part of the installation funky
customer_reviews.text: We were replacing an old unit we had installed ten plus years ago. This unit is much louder and part way through the installation they have you take the blades off and put on again. We are debating returning the fan because we were so happy with our other unit and this one we have to be very selective about when to run it because of the excessive noise and rattle.
customer_reviews.author: Readbabe

customer_reviews.title: Cools my house nicely
customer_reviews.text: Works well. A little noisy but it does the job. Has everything needed in the box. I wasn’t able to use it in my ceiling due to how my house is built, but with a little modification to the grill, I was able to install in a wall at a vaulted ceiling
customer_reviews.author: Declan W.

customer_reviews.title: Poor instructions, works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well but the vent was not square which made installation difficult. The blade was on upside down from the factory and the instructions are TERRIBLE (“install properly”...) But, we have been using the fan for a week and it works great now that it is installed.
customer_reviews.author: fishinadish

customer_reviews.title: Worth it and does its job
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Feels a bit like sitting inside a turboprop aircraft at high speeds. Empties air from my 1700sqft single story home in minutes. The switches didn't work well. I used a regular 3-way for the high low control and timer for on/off.
customer_reviews.author: Deepak Patel

customer_reviews.title: Great fan!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome fan! Really glad I got this. The install wasn’t too hard although I didn’t run the electric to a switch, I attached a plug and plugged it into a smart outlet that I can control with an app. My house is over 3000 square feet and this fan creates a great breeze throughout the entire house. I expected the fan to be louder based on other reviews but it’s not. The fan is right outside my bedroom door and I can sleep with the fan on if my door is shut.
customer_reviews.author: Mayberry

customer_reviews.title: Well build. Complete in 4-6 hours.
customer_reviews.text: Seems well built, install took 4-6 hours. Fan blades well not the bad moved up toward the end of the drive shaft. Not a big deal. If you are wiring it yourself take pictures of the old wiring, it will help. I installed in stairway of 2 story Home 1850 sf. With 800 sf finished walk out basement. Works great I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jon H.

customer_reviews.title: Poor after purchase service or care!!!
customer_reviews.text: Using to suck in cool air at night to cool down house and attic. Works well and everything is ok except the shutter. I emailed the company as soon as we had it installed on july 7. Shutter does not close properly and we can’t figure out why not. Have not heard a word from the company about the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard L Hassman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome House Fan
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quick. Very easy to install and wire up. Comes with both on/off and high/low switch so no need to purchase one separately. Very well packaged for shipping so there was no damaged at all. Very happy with the price. On high it’s a little loud but that’s to be expected with this style of fan. Pulls the house temp down very quickly when the ambient temperature cools off at night
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Seamons

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: It took my handy husband about 6-8 hours to install this, with little help from me...we don't have A/C in our house and this has made a huge difference during the summer evenings when the house heats up. Can't answer any install questions but I definitely recommend this fan.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great fan
customer_reviews.text: Two days after install and im pleased. The fan will cool my townhouse pretty quick. You Imediatly feel the draft once the fan is on.. I reduced to 4 stars because the motor mounting hardware was no good and the box frame of the fan was coming apart when i opened the box. Easy install if your handy with tools took half the day
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great fan! came Undamaged in a huge box
customer_reviews.text: Great fan! came Undamaged in a huge box! and i mean huge. Everything works great and i love using it now that the weather has gotten nicer. Cools my 1400 sq ft colonial home very fast in the cool afternoons and it gets all that hot air out of my attic. Also great for getting smells out the house like when the wife burns dinner. I would also suggest getting a good timer switch instead of whats included. I'm sure the switches they give you would work just fine but they are pretty cheap like everyone else says. I like to set a time and walk away not having to worry.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Lafean

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It was not fun to install but what did I expect when I chose to install in the middle of summer all by myself. Once it was done it worked great though!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Carter

customer_reviews.title: Works great but a little noisy..
customer_reviews.text: Fan is fairly noisy. I installed a smaller pulley on the motor. Problem solved. Slowed the fan down a little bit. Quieted right up. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzo

customer_reviews.title: Fan is great! The leuvered vent sucks and doesn't fit
customer_reviews.text: The vent that came with the fan doesn't come close to fitting. The fan itself does a fantastic job and the noise level is very tolerable
customer_reviews.author: Special K

customer_reviews.title: Good fan for the price. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Good fan for the price. If you're looking for quiet fan this one is not for you. I bought two of these fans and both work good. The blades cut through the air loudly but it's acceptable for large cfm fan. The major problem I had was how they're packaged. Both fans came with some scratches do to loose stuff flying around, screws and other parts. One of the fans box came dented and demaged. Fan motor is made in Taiwan and most likely the rest of the fan.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Best thing my money could buy!!
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing bad I can say about the cool attic fan. The day it was being delivered (a day early I might add) I was able to see it "live" coming to my door. ( I thought that was pretty cool) install was a little tricky, this also could have been because this was the first project for my husband and I to do together. After a few songs and a couple of high fives later, we were pleased with this very very quite fan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save on your air condition AC bills!
customer_reviews.text: Installation was a LOT more work than I was planning on. This was in a house that never had an attic fan. Overall I'm pleased with how it all turned out. I didn't use the switches it came with but wires a 3 way heavy duty switch in to serve as the high/low speed and in front of that added a timer switch. Make sure you have enough ventilation in your attic for the hot air to escape, and make sure to open your windows first! This will blow out the pilot light on your gas water heater if there isn't enough open windows..
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Shipped without fan belt, motor pulley wheel, hardware ...
customer_reviews.text: Shipped without fan belt, motor pulley wheel, hardware, packaging slip or installation instructions. Just plain weird. It's as if a robot packaged it.... Reordered and it was again sent without requisite parts! Tested the motor and it burned out in 10 min! Serious fire hazard; do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kristian L. Blom

customer_reviews.title: Installation was very easy once all the measurements were done correctly
customer_reviews.text: Installation was very easy once all the measurements were done correctly. The set came with all necessary switches (on/off, hi/lo), and the instruction of wiring was very clear. I also found an installation video on youtube if the manual was not clear enough. Overall, the fan works great, it draws all the hot air out of the house, and the house cools down a lot quicker than turning on the air condition. This fan can also force all hot air out of the attic. I am very sure I am going to save a lot of money on my electricity bills.
customer_reviews.author: Allen T.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy install. Much quieter than I expected. I installed in my garage to help cool it from this Texas heat so it’s bearable to work in.
customer_reviews.author: LTCTLB

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality assurance
customer_reviews.text: I am satisfied with this fan, it cools my house just fine. I marked the rating down because the manufacturer has terrible quality assurance - the fan as received COULD NOT RUN!. They installed a junction box on the motor so that the box interfered with the fan blades - the fan could not turn. I removed the junction box (2 screws) and cleared the fan, now it operates just fine. However that leaves the wiring junctions "out in the breeze".
customer_reviews.author: Don M Westergren

customer_reviews.title: Great unit.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. I located it away from the opening about 8’ so the fan was not over the opening for sound reasons. Works awesome.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: The great thing is that I contacted the manufacturer and they ...
customer_reviews.text: The fan came right on time as expected, but was the blade was a bit out of balance which shook the whole thing making it a little louder than expected. The great thing is that I contacted the manufacturer and they sent me out a new blade for assembly and installation. It was really easy and now it works great. Great customer service by the manufacturer!
customer_reviews.author: 2Peps

customer_reviews.title: Does what its supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: The installation wasn't to difficult if you have some diy knowledge. There weren't any issues with the motor it works fine. It's a little loud but that is to be expected when you are moving that much air. Everything arrived packed well without any damage.
customer_reviews.author: Mark V

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot. Keeps my house cool. Be sure that it’ll fit through your attic door. I had to take it apart to get it in the attic, then put it back together. But it works like a horse!
customer_reviews.author: James Turner

customer_reviews.title: Some question of overall quality.
customer_reviews.text: The fan I received was not the Amazon 30 inch fan originally on your website. It was a substitute from a different manufacturer. I have no way of knowing whether the quality is comparable. This fan is very noisy on high speed. Also the fan shutters were damaged in shipping.(poorly packed. The manufacturer replaced the shutters within 5 days. The fan that was backordered had shutters that had a powder coated finish. Speaks of high quality. Also, my fan makes a clunking sound upon startup. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: frank schumacher

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the Cool and saves money vs. the AC
customer_reviews.text: We Love it! Does just what it supposed to do. Pulls in the cool air in the evening, helps keep the house comfortable and cool. Thought the two separate wall switches to use its two speed capability was kind if "chincy". So we bought the Air Vent #58030 2SPD Wall Switch that will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Skyjim

customer_reviews.title: Really moves the air but a bit noisy.
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the other reviews about the noise generated by this unit we took pains to mount this on thick foam weatherstrip. It was also positioned on top of the framing rather than between the ceiling joists so as to gain a few more inches of distance. As a result, there is no appreciable vibration transmitted to the house structure. The noise of the air movement is still appreciable, especially on HIGH. This fan really moves the hot air out of the room quickly!
customer_reviews.author: Terry M.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality motor
customer_reviews.text: After spending quite a few hours in the hot attic for the installation I only got to use it for about an hour before the motor died. I will be swapping it for a higher quality motor whenever I feel like getting back into the attic.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Bought Fan 2016 and didn't last past 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Was placed in our hot garage in Western Oklahoma to help hot attic since our roof fan went out , and husband cut our trees down due to drought. Very pleased with product . However it went out 3 short years after purchasing this product. I kept all the original paper work and it shows a 10 year warranty however no where can I find a phone number, website, or email address to contact someone about the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Cindyb

customer_reviews.title: Really cools off the house
customer_reviews.text: We have a 1700 sq. ft. house and installed this in the upstairs foyer. You have to be selective about which rooms you want to cool, only leaving windows open in one or two locations. But it really draws the cool air in after the sun sets and cools off the targeted rooms in 20 minutes or so. Has made a huge difference in the comfort of the house as the day turns to evening. So far, no problems. It is a bit noisy but this doesn't really cause much of a problem. We run it on the one hour timer and that seems to be plenty of time to work it's magic.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Delany

customer_reviews.title: Received in good condition.
customer_reviews.text: I received this item in good condition and undamaged. Haven’t installed it yet but I will continue this review afterward.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah henrichs

customer_reviews.title: Good fan Horrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: Fan arrived bent and broken. Great price, however and I was able to straighten and repair start capacitor which had broken away from motor mount in shipment. The manufacture should spend $5 more for packaging, and this may insure the product arrives to the customer in working order. Once the fan was repaired it worked as advertised. A little loud, but it does the job. Switches are adequate and do the job. I would add a timer in place of the on off switch. Great installation video on U-Tube.
customer_reviews.author: D. Turner

customer_reviews.title: the next day worked fine again now its 90 still at 9pm so not ...
customer_reviews.text: might end up a five but shut down on me once not sure why I run it on low in the garage with one window open the one time I didn't pull the blind up it ran for a half hour but when I went to shut it down 2 hours later was already off and wouldn't turn on again, the next day worked fine again now its 90 still at 9pm so not using it right now.
customer_reviews.author: digger_van

customer_reviews.title: Oversized
customer_reviews.text: It was supposed to be 24 inch but needed 29 inches for installation and not enough space to do it without major structure changes to roof rafters.
customer_reviews.author: Don Chisholm

customer_reviews.title: Find something else
customer_reviews.text: This fan is garbage...cheap Chinese product. I don’t even know where to start. The blade is held on with a 4 point bolt that you can’t get to; hope you DIYers have an 8 point socket set. Once I got past that, the motor is wired in the wrong direction, forcing hot attic air into the house. Oh, and the phone number provided is disconnected. If you buy this fan...best of luck to you.
customer_reviews.author: The McTavish Family

customer_reviews.title: Alternative to A/C
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product ..installation instructions were very clear , cools entire house within an hour
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great value but you need to understand airflow and home construction I would recommend you consult with a pro before you purchase
customer_reviews.author: Shancarol

customer_reviews.title: Dead
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two years ago. Just getting around to install. Once in place started to smell wire burning followed by smoke.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Weber

customer_reviews.title: The fan came off the shaft
customer_reviews.text: All was well for a time, but then the fan came off the shaft and destroyed the cover.
customer_reviews.author: Darleen March

customer_reviews.title: When it works...
customer_reviews.text: I have a two story house so I ordered this attic fan to cool the upstairs. It gets very hot mid 80s & 90s. This thing sometimes won't even stay on for an hour. I just turned it on at 10:30, it started making a groaning noise at 10:47. I wish I could upload a idea for my review.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: good fan
customer_reviews.text: Should have done this years ago. Other have suggested to check that all nuts and bolts are tight, good advice and like anything that needs some assembly you need to make sure the drive pulley and the driven pulley are aligned and then the belt is properly tightened. Fan works great, the noise level is not bad but it is a fan moving a lot of air, the belt drive is quieter than the direct drive I was making do with.
customer_reviews.author: JohnP

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement
customer_reviews.text: Due to several interruptions, I have not yet installed this fan, but it appears in every way to be all it is advertised to be. The instructions may require reading two or three times to be clear which way to install it, but extra time reading is well spent. Like the old saying, "Measure twice and saw once" certainly applies here also. I hope to get it installed soon and it will be a great improvement to my garage when warm weather comes back again.
customer_reviews.author: Wilbur C. Carruth

customer_reviews.title: Love this fan
customer_reviews.text: Installed in a day. Watched the videos online and it went smooth. Probably could have gone with the smaller fan as I only need it to be on low.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Installed easily after I watched a couple YouTube videos
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily after I watched a couple YouTube videos. Still took me most of a day. It's loud for the room your in but not terribly so just sounds like a large fan. No problems with noise being any distance or another room away from it. No vibration problems or anything. Makes a lot of difference at night. Cools the whole house down very well. I'm only I'm a 1100 Sq ft house and this is plenty for that.
customer_reviews.author: Farsight

customer_reviews.title: It's really a Cool Attic CX30BD2SPD.  Great fan.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why this is labeled a "Ventamatic". It is a Cool Attic CX30BD2SPD. Maybe it's just relabeled. Go check out the reviews over there, but in a nutshell, I like it a lot. I "tweaked" a few things for install, but it is nice and quiet and moves a ton of air.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Burt

customer_reviews.title: Belt drive fan is much quieter than our old direct ...
customer_reviews.text: Belt drive fan is much quieter than our old direct drive system at our old house. Make sure you open windows/doors as the motor shut down when my wife closed the slider and the fan overheated, even on low speed. Came on automatically after it cooled down. Moves a lot of air!
customer_reviews.author: fatherreilly

customer_reviews.title: Good fan.
customer_reviews.text: This fan functions well, but it is loud. It seems to move less air than my 40 plus year old fan that recently stopped working. It is used in my shop and will be adequate for me. The fan was shipped quickly and I am satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AMB

customer_reviews.title: Love this attic fan
customer_reviews.text: Love this attic fan. Easy to install. I did not use the switches that came with it because I only wanted one switch on wall-it had an on/off switch and also a speed switch.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Great for our house
customer_reviews.text: Ranch house, cools 1st floor, had it installed professionally, buy the switch too so you don't get stuck ready to install with no switch.
customer_reviews.author: C. Loomis

customer_reviews.title: the other reviewers taht said it too loud are wrong
customer_reviews.text: as described, works great, not too loud. Fan blades chopping air make noise, the other people are goofy. The motor doesn't make a sound and the blades are well balanced, but does make noise as the blades chop the air when its on. The louvers are nice, they seem flimsy, but work great.
customer_reviews.author: Montgomery Burns

customer_reviews.title: Cool fan!!
customer_reviews.text: This fan was a great buy! It was packaged well and had no damages. My husband installed it himself after looking up how to do it on YouTube and reading the manual carefully. The only downfall is the two switches it comes with instead of it being all in one. One switch is on and off and the other is high and low. Other than that, it is a great product and it really cools the house down after a warm day.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Cool Attic CX30BD2SPD Belt Drive 2-Speed Whole House Attic Fan with Shutter, 30 Inch
product_meta.description:
Style:30 Inch Belt Drive Whole House FanThe Cool Attic 30 in. belt drive 2-speed whole house fan is designed for 2,000 to 3,000 sq. ft. homes. It offers an efficient way to reduce cooling costs, while keeping your whole house more comfortable and full of clean, fresh air. It works by pulling fresh air in from the outside and expelling the warm air up into the attic and pushing it out through your attic exhaust vents. This unit requires a minimum of 10-12 sq. ft. of net free exhaust vent area to perform quietly and efficiently. Dual, self-aligning ball bearing mechanisms, and a precision-balanced 4-blade aluminum fan assembly contributes to quiet, reliable performance and longevity.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This Cool Attic 30-inch belt drive 2-speed whole house fan with shutters will help cool down your home in those hot months. It has a precision-balanced aluminum fan blade assembly with 4 blades, unlike 3 in most competing brands for greater air movement. It has a joist-in/joist out installation and steel venturi for enhanced durability. The shutter is a white powder-coated finish automatic shutter with 95% plus air closure. A wall switch is included with high/low/off settings. It is UL and C-UL listed and comes with a 10 year warranty. This model is designed for 2,000 to 3,000 square feet on one story and has a CFM high/low of 7,800/5,400. This unit needs 10 to 12 square feet of net free exhaust area. Rough Opening: 29-1/2-Inch x 32-1/4-Inch, Outside Shutter Dimensions: 31-1/2-Inch x 34-Inch.
feature_bullets: WHOLE HOUSE FAN: The cool attic 30 in. belt drive 2-speed whole house fan is designed for houses with 2,000 to 3,000 sq. ft. attics. It offers an efficient way to reduce cooling costs, while keeping your whole house more comfortable. It features a powder coated finish for weather resistance

ATTIC FAN: It works by pulling fresh air in from the outside and expelling the warm air up into the attic and pushing it out through your attic exhaust vents. Save on energy costs, remove stale, unhealthy air, and improve your home's atmosphere. What's not to love?

MADE IN AMERICA: No cut corners, no cheap parts, no worry installation. Made in the heartland of Texas, we've been assembling fans since 1948 with legendary customer service. Don't save a dollar and gain a headache, go with quality you can trust.

QUIET ENGINEERING: Re-engineered bracing system creates a more stable motor mount, is stronger than tube-style bracing, and virtually eliminates vibration. No more helicopter in your hallway, these units are quieter with less vibration than the units of yesteryear. Easy to install with an immediate return on investment.

POWERFUL WHOLE HOUSE FAN : The most important part of the whole fan system is the motor, and we don't dissapoint. Our powerful motors will cycle the air in your home in no time, leaving you refreshed and cool.

specifications.Style: 30 Inch Belt Drive Whole House Fan
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars544 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
